intro: Guizotia bidentoides, commonly known as the two-toothed guizotia, is an annual herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head, with both ray and disk florets. Guizotia bidentoides is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
